official-title.#text: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to encourage mixed-income housing development.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Low and Moderate Income Housing Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Low and Moderate Income Housing Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Mixed-income housing test for low-income housing credit

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended to read as
			 follows:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text:
The project meets the requirements of this subparagraph if 50 percent or more of the residential
			 units in such project are both rent-restricted and occupied by individuals
			 whose income is at least 50 percent, but not more than 120 percent, of
			 area median gross income.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
with respect to housing credit dollar amounts
			 allocated from State housing credit ceilings after the date of the
			 enactment of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 42 of the Internal
			 Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to determinations under

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4130 IH: Low and Moderate Income Housing Act of 2014

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
